class maxaifeaturization.transformation.transform.DateTimeTransform[source]

Bases: object

static convert_to_iso8601(df, col_name, is_epoch, **kwargs)[source]

converts a string or epoch datetime to ISO-8601 format > Assumption - epoch should be upto second level (i.e. of 10 digits)

Args:

df (PySpark DataFrame) col_name (string): column name is_epoch (bool): if the input passed is of Unix epoch type or not

Returns:

PySpark DataFrame

static log(df, col_name, **kwargs)[source]

computes logarithm (natural)

Args:

df (PySpark DataFrame) col_name (string): column name

Raises:

exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised when datatype is not numeric ValueError: raised if negative values or zero is encountered

Returns:

PySpark DataFrame

static alter_case(df, col_name, case, **kwargs)[source]

alters a string column to Uppercase or lowercase (decided by the case parameter)

static concat_columns(df, col_list, **kwargs)[source]

concatenate two columns, using a delimiter (‘,’ by default)

static one_hot_encoder(df, col_list, **kwargs)[source]

maps a column of category indices to a column of binary vectors

exceptions.IncorrectDataTypeError: raised if any of the input columns is not of numeric dtype
